results.title: Somewhere in time
results.creator_credit: Jeannot Szwarc, Stephen Deutsch and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A man is given an antique gold watch from an old woman who pleads with him to travel back in time with her. Years later, the man, Richard, is overwhelmed by a photograph of a beautiful woman. Seeing a picture of the woman in her later years, Richard realises that she is the same woman who gave him the watch, and that they had an affair the time the photo was taken. He becomes obsessed with returning to 1912 and being reunited with the young woman and is willing to sacrifice his life in the present to find happiness in the past. Cast includes Christopher Reeve, Jane Seymour, Christopher Plummer and Teresa Wright. Based on the novel “Bid time return” by Richard Matheson.

results.title: Beetle juice
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Wilson, Michael Bender, Richard Hashimoto and The Geffen Company
results.brief_description: Geena Davis and Alec Baldwin are happy, content and alive until a car accident turns them into ghosts, forever stuck in an afterlife - a holding cell for people who have died of unnatural causes. No sooner is the funeral over and their home is sold and “invaded” by two new trendy tenants. In desperation they enlist the help of a freelance bio-exorcist, Betelgeuse (Michael Keaton), to scare the new owners off the premises. This notion provides Keaton with a vehicle for showing off his comic talents. Story by Michael McDowell and Larry Wilson with music by Danny Elfman. Cast includes Geena Davis, Alec Baldwin, Michael Keaton, Catherine O’Hara and Winona Ryder. (Awards: Oscar for Best Achievement in Makeup).

results.title: The Killing
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, James B. Harris, Harris-Kubrick Pictures Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A race-track robbery is planned with clockwork precision but Kubrick dispassionately observes how the mechanism is ruined by human fallibility. The intricate flashback structure presents a plot of chess-like moves in a hard boiled, visually stylised underworld richly populated by film noir stereotypes. Based on the novel “Clean Break” by Lionel White. Cast includes Sterling Hayden, Coleen Gray, Vince Edwards and Jay C Flippen.

results.title: Breaking up
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, George Moffly, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Regency Entertainment (USA)
results.brief_description: Using vignettes, still photos, interviews, and the New York landscape, this film follows the trials and tribulations of Steve (Russell Crowe) and Monica’s (Salma Hayek) tumultuous relationship that vacillates between being together, and breaking up. The two realise that they can’t live with each other, but can’t do without the other either and are trapped in a continuous process of breaking up then making up. Ultimately, they have to decide what it is that’s holding them together when the excitement of their renewed sexual attraction that occurs when they make up seems to be the overarching link between them. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Cristofer.

results.title: Far and away
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: The setting is the West Coast of Ireland, 1892. Joseph Donnelly (Tom Cruise), a poor tenant farmer, is determined to bring justice to the oppressive landlord responsible for killing his father. After setting fire to the landlord’s house, Donnelly runs into the landlord’s daughter Shannon (Nicole Kidman), and together they head for America - the two united by their desire to own their own land. Initially things seem to indicate a positive future for Joseph and Shannon who are posing as brother and sister. They secure lodgings, and Joseph is able to bring in a small income by boxing. The security doesn’t last however, and the two must separate, just as they discover their true feelings for one another. Joseph begins work on a railroad, his goal to possess his own land in the new territory never far from his thoughts. Once again, Shannon re enters his world, only this time she has a fiance, but still shares Joseph’s dream to own her own land.

results.title: The Brood
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Claude Heroux, Elgin International Films and Mutual Productions
results.brief_description: Director David Cronenberg considers this film his most personal one to date. A bold admission considering the disturbing material and particularly bitter look at marital break ups and the psychological effects that are passed down the generations. Cronenberg treats his themes of family dysfunction with his usual trade marks of experimental therapies run amuck and bodies rebelling against their hosts in the most visceral and graphic ways. Oliver Reed plays Doctor Hal Raglan, the mind behind an unconventional and radical institute which deals specifically with the physical effects of rage on the human body. One of his star pupils, the deranged Nola (Samantha Eggar), begins to use this very strange form of anger management to get back at her ex-husband (Art Hindle) who has custody of their five year old daughter. Cast also includes Cindy Hinds, Henry Beckman, Nuala Fitzgerald.

results.title: The Getaway
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, David Foster, Mitchell Brower and First Artists
results.brief_description: In one of his most hard-bitten roles, Steve McQueen plays “Doc” McCoy, a master thief who is released on a parole arranged by his wife (Ali MacGraw) who sleeps with a political big shot. In return for this favour, McCoy must lead a group of professional thieves on a bank heist, including his wife as the getaway driver. What follows is a sinister succession of double-crosses that sour the deal until the final climactic shoot-out. This violent film, typical of Peckinpah, relentlessly depicts ruthless robbery and murder, not to mention adultery, kidnapping, bribery, extortion and general mayhem. No-one in this film is honourable or attractive, and yet the viewer finds themself actually hoping that McQueen and MacGraw, thieves though they are, will get away. Cast includes: Steve McQueen, Ali MacGraw, Ben Johnson, Sally Struthers, Al Lettieri and Slim Pickens.

results.title: Speed
results.creator_credit: Jan De Bont, Mark Gordon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Fast moving, action packed and relentless, ‘Speed’ transports the viewer into a world gone mad, as a terrorist “mad bomber” (Dennis Hopper) holds a bus load of innocent passengers to ransom. Keanu Reeves is a SWAT specialist who must ensure that the bus keeps speeding through the streets of Los Angeles at no less than 50mph if the passengers are to stay alive. Co-starring Sandra Bullock and Jeff Daniels.

results.title: Bean
results.creator_credit: Mel Smith, Eric Fellner, Peter Bennett-Jones, Tim Evans, NV Polygrams S A and PolyGram Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: In an attempt to get rid of their most inept and detested employee, Mr Bean, The Royal National Gallery of London send him to America to oversee the unveiling of America’s most treasured painting, ‘Whistler’s mother’. The staff of the Grierson Gallery in Los Angeles are not privy to the gallery’s rationale for sending Mr Bean, and still believe that they are dealing with a man of the finest intellect, the scholarly Dr Bean. While in America Mr Bean is billetted to stay with David Langley (Peter MacNicol), much to the annoyance of his family who seriously doubt his supposedly brilliant credentials. As Mr Bean unleashes his particular brand of behaviour, which inevitably ends in disaster, they too begin to wonder about the enigmatic Mr Bean. The most significant of his disasters includes destroying ‘Whistlers’ mother’, forcing him into panic mode to rectify the situation before he gives a speech at the grand unveiling. Cast also includes Mel Smith, Pamela Reed and Harris Yulin. Includes 20 minutes of unseen footage as well as interviews with Rowan Atkinson and Mel Smith.

results.title: Ulee's gold
results.creator_credit: Victor Nunez, Clinica Estetico and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This touching film presents a subtle study of the difficulties and complexities involved in the development and maintenance of lasting human relations. It reveals how abnormal events force one self-exiled loner to reassess his moral and emotional beliefs and to redeem his sense of personal and familial strength. Ulee, a Vietnam veteran turned beekeeper, in the tradition of generations before him, watches his family disintegrate when his son, Jimmy, lands in jail for robbery and his daughter-in-law disappears, leaving their two daughters in Ulee’s care. Ulee takes refuge from this state of affairs in the production of his high-grade honey with the unspoken assistance of his youngest granddaughter. However, when Jimmy’s partners begin threatening his family, thinking that Jimmy has hidden the proceeds of their robbery, Ulee’s stubbornly suppressed sense of the unconditional bond and care that links his family begins to surface and he becomes involved in the tenuous situation. Nunez handles this film with a simplicity and sensitivity that effectively evokes the personal journey of Ulee and the rest of his family in challenging circumstances.
